definition: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations.
A way of representing information using only two options.
A function passed into another function as an argument.
The process of finding and resolving defects in software.
The process of giving someone permission to do or have something.
A basic structure underlying a system, concept, or text.
A distributed version-control system for tracking changes.
The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed.
An object-oriented programming principle.
A lightweight format for storing and transporting data.
A sequence of instructions that is continually repeated.
Software that acts as a bridge between an operating system.
A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine.
A particular instance of a class where the object can be a combination.
The ability of different objects to respond in a unique way.
The process of making a software system available for use.
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
A set of software tools and programs used by developers.
A piece of data that represents a claim to be authenticated.
The address of a World Wide Web page.
An element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
A method of augmenting or altering the behavior of a web page.
A markup language that defines a set of rules for encoding documents.
A human-readable data serialization standard for all programming languages.
A CSS property that sets the z-order of a positioned element.
The process of converting information or data into a code.
A network security device that monitors and filters incoming and outgoing network traffic.
A person who uses computers to gain unauthorized access to data.
The process of bringing together different systems or software applications to function as a whole.
A programming language commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.
The core component of an operating system that provides basic services for all other parts of the operating system.
A family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel.
The process of transferring data, applications, or other business elements from one system, storage, or server to another.
A group of interconnected computers, servers, mainframes, network devices, or other devices.
The software that manages computer hardware resources and provides common services for computer programs.
The process of creating a set of instructions that tell a computer how to perform a task.
A request for information from a database.
The process of selecting a path for traffic in a network or between multiple networks.
A computer program or device that provides functionality for other programs or devices, called clients.
